intro: Calymmodon mnioides, commonly known as the yellow mangrove, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant thrives in saline and brackish water environments, often found in mangrove forests. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a waxy surface to reduce water loss. Calymmodon mnioides plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
